div.p: Most illustrious man, I believe the honorable envoy to be a sincere man, and that he will fulfill what he promises.
He solemnly promised me money; why should I not believe that I will receive it, especially since he has given you good words.
It does no harm to have written.
Greetings, most excellent Bullinger, may God preserve you with your entire family, school, and church.
I am indeed well; if you are well, that is good.
I had received your letters from Chur, which brought me great joy.
Praise be to God; the most illustrious triumphs, who is in excellent health. The grace and peace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
If money is to be sent, let it be sent specifically to T端bingen to the son of Cellarius, a well-known man, Rudolf Riepi. T端bingen, August 5, 1564.
To the most illustrious man, Heinrich Bullinger, Antistes of Z端rich, honorable brother. In Z端rich.
